item.title: The Mismeasure of Man and Models
item.description: (Blog post written by Hannah Chen) Evaluating Allocational Harms in Large Language Models Our work addresses allocational harms that arise when model predictions perpetuate unfair distribution of resources or opportunities. Current Bias Metrics Do Not Reliably Reflect Allocation Disparities Several methods have been proposed to audit large language models (LLMs) for bias when used in critical decision-making, such as resume screening for hiring. Yet, these methods focus on predictions, without considering how the predictions are used to make decisions.
